title: If the universe is an illusion, what is the point in its existence? - Quora

Ganesh, A fantastic question, because you declare life as we know it as an illusion, yet you still ask for the meaning of it all. Something cannot be right, but at the same time you are asking this question for a good reason. Let’s first take the illusory part of our existence. I can agree with you that to some extent illusion is part of our lives. Illusions exist perhaps to help guide us through phases. If we all knew about the troubles ahead, would we still want to move forward? And yet while moving through some painful periods, we can come out on the other end stronger and more mature. What I disagree with you about your illusion statement is that you declare all to be illusory (or at least that is how you phrased it), and that cannot be correct. It cannot be all illusion. If there is no actual contents, then we would not exist. So, we have to investigate the layer of illusion that is somehow part of life. —- Let’s move to the other part first, before making both come together. The point in our existence is yet again well put. You’re asking about the meaning of the universe, of life, and perhaps how the individual needs to deal with this. I am not the first to make this statement, but the meaning of life is what you make it. This is not some facetious answer; it contains a rather complex aspect to it. We find ourselves in a directed setting (most certainly so as children), and as adults we need to give ourselves (and perhaps others) direction. Some of us have to start out from scratch finding direction and that can be quite difficult. To give oneself direction requires an understanding of what makes you tick, requires an understanding of what makes you interested in your world. This can be a negative approach (and you then want to make the world “a better place”), or it can follow a love (a love for art, a love for people, etc). —- Let’s bring both together. Living in a directed world or universe, having to find one’s own way to further a personal direction, tells us that there is indeed no singular reality, but a combination of realities occurring at the same time. Because the universe is a directed place (outward movement for all matter in the universe), we have to acknowledge that there was either something wrong or something so beautiful that this direction (in all directions) occurred. This means there was a prior state from which it all derived. As they say in Buddhism, our universe is a result, it is not the original. But of course it will contain some aspects of the original. We are part and parcel of this result. The blissful moment some would love to see at the end of any story will not occur, it is an illusion. The universe is on an eternal journey and there will not be a moment it all ends. However, moments of bliss can and will indeed occur throughout our lifetimes. This requires us to have made decisions about our own direction in life, and to know when to enjoy the fruits that come around every so often. Life is real, and the illusion is just one part of life. Pricking through the veneer allows us to examine what we like or dislike, allows us to grow into a different phase, and this can allow us to connect with the center of our own being.

The universe is same as your consciousness in a different format. That is one reason why the universe is perceived as illusion. Questioning the point behind the existence of universe is same as questioning the point behind your life. We do not look upon our life as pointless or meaningless. Everyone has his own motivation to carry on in life to pursue the goals set by him. As such there is no point in questioning the purpose or meaning behind the existence of the universe. Man can question the point or purpose behind what he does or makes consciously. He has no locus standi to question the existence of something over which he has no control and which has come about without his conscious determination.
